definition: to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to watch helplessly
to get angry/to fume
to stare angrily or vacantly

sentences.english: He was staring at the Place Saint-Michel.
sentences.chinese: 他瞪眼看着米歇尔广场。

sentences.english: The audience stares at the rows of red pixels .
sentences.chinese: 观众们瞪眼看着一排排红色像素。

sentences.english: Waiting time does not have to be wasted time.
sentences.chinese: 等候的时间未必就要干瞪眼。

sentences.english: He glared at John and was annoyed by his refusal to cooperate.
sentences.chinese: 他瞪眼看着约翰，对他拒绝合作感到恼怒。

sentences.english: Stare. Your eyes can bulge somewhat.
sentences.chinese: 瞪眼，你的眼睛可以鼓出来。

sentences.english: Don't glare at your teacher like that. You deserved the scolding.
sentences.chinese: 别那么瞪眼望着老师，你该被骂的。

sentences.english: She goggled at me in surprise.
She could do nothing but stare and wonder.
sentences.chinese: 她只能瞪眼和感到很纳闷而已。

sentences.english: Annoyed commuters could only watch as the departure time ticked by.
sentences.chinese: 随着发车时间一点点过去，恼怒的上班族只能干瞪眼。

sentences.english: Why are you scowling at me?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么要瞪眼怒视我？

sentences.english: Eye to Eye With an Elephant, and Watching for Hungry Crocs, on Safari in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 跟大象眼瞪眼，守候饥饿的鳄鱼，非洲探险之旅。

sentences.english: Having stuffed himself with blackberries, Timmy could only sit staring at the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 蒂米塞了一肚子的黑莓，在饭桌上只好干瞪眼了。

sentences.english: They couldn't do anything but stand there and stare.
sentences.chinese: 除了站那里干瞪眼外，他们什么也做不了。

sentences.english: Papa 's stare is a conventional stopper to our requests.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的瞪眼是对我们请求事项的常见的决定性的回答。

sentences.english: The audience stares at the rows of red pixels.
sentences.chinese: 观众们瞪眼看着那排红色像素。

sentences.english: Timmy could only sit staring at the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 在饭桌上只好干瞪眼了。

definition: to roll one's eyes
to get angry/to fume
to pout
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
variant of 愣[leng4]/to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank
variant of 稜|棱, corner/square beam/edge/arris (curve formed by two surfaces meeting at an edge)/see 楞迦 Sri Lanka
to pout (to express anger or displeasure)
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
very fierce
to glare at
to look askance/cross or wall-eyed
to put on a straight, stern or blank face/to put on a poker face
to put one's hands on one's hips/also written 插腰[cha1 yao1]
